description: Dive into "Capturing Bodrum: A Photogenic Journey" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Capturing Bodrum: A Photogenic Journey

places.generalDescription: Bodrum Ancient Theatre, dating back to the 4th century BC, is situated on the southern slope of Goktepe in the north of the Ancient City of Halicarnassus. With a seating capacity of around 13,000 people, it consists of three main parts: rows of seats, orchestra, and stage. Originally built by Mausolos, it now serves as a tourist attraction and event venue for various cultural events like ballet festivals and concerts.

sources.snippet: Before arriving, check ahead to make sure the entrance is open, as sadly we weren‚Äôt able to go inside when we stopped past at 5pm, but the theatre itself is yet another teleportation to an ancient time, when gladiators performed and kings ruled with vigor. We luckily managed to grab a couple pics through the fence, to give you a great idea of what to expect, but we highly recommend going during opening hours.
sources.shortName: 9 INSTA-WORTHY LOCATIONS IN BODRUM, TURKEY

sources.snippet: The ancient theatre is a ‚Äúliving‚Äù witness of the great past of ancient Halicarnassus. Bodrum Antique Theatre is one of the most popular attractions among tourists. It is located almost in the center of the city, on a mountain that has a breathtaking Bodrum view, and it was built in the 4th century BC.
sources.shortName: Discover Bodrum: Top 20 Things to Do

sources.snippet: The Ancient Theater is the only structure in Bodrum that come from the Classical period. It is one of the oldest theaters in Anatolia. It has been restored in the 60s and has a capacity of 13 thousand people.
sources.shortName: The Best Places to Visit in Bodrum ‚Äì Toursce Turkey

places.name: Bodrum Ancient Theatre

reviews.text: I picked the day of a music event at the ancient theatre, where a stage had already been erected. Rather than clamber over the seats and rows of the theatre in those circumstances, I opted to take photos from across the dual carriage roadway. Lots of traffic as it was the weekend, so my photos include cars. Nevertheless seeing the amphitheater was worth the short climb on an extremely hot day. The views of Bodrum from there are spectacular. I highly recommend making the short trek.

It was worth a visit to understand what it was like centuries ago when the theatre was  first built. You can imagine how the audience felt by sitting in different areas of the theatre and looking out towards the sea.  The bus stop is a short walk to the main entrance, and the buses are frequent enough to go back into Bodrum, or other areas.

We got there during a weekday in slow spring season. There were no cruise ships in port which means we got the whole place to ourselves. It was free to access, and you can go up the theatre. If left unmaintained, nature easily takes over. You can see pics online of what it looks like when the grass is cut.

Toilets were closed when we got there. Not much historical facts to read. However, the site is on the side of a main road and worth a quick stop.

places.address: Yenik√∂y, D330 No:175 D:169, 48440 Bodrum/Muƒüla, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Bodrum Castle, also known as the Castle of St. Peter or Petronium, is a historic landmark in Bodrum overlooking the international port. Built in the 15th century by the Knights of Rhodes, it has served various purposes over time including a church and a mosque during the Ottoman Empire. Today, it houses a significant underwater archaeology museum and was designated as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 2016.

sources.snippet: Bodrum Castle was built in 1522 as the castle of the Knights of St Jean, and it is a symbol of Bodrum. It was built on rocks surrounded by sea on three sides between two harbors and now is used as Bodrum Museum of Underwater Archeology. In the castle, you can see works belonging to many important collections which exhibited in sections such as Turkish bath, Karyan Princess Hall, Classical Period Hall, Amphora and Camlik Hall, offering clues about ancient periods.
sources.shortName: The Best Places to Visit in Bodrum ‚Äì Toursce Turkey

sources.snippet:
Source:
 Photo 
by Wikimedia Commons user
 Ad Meskens 
used under CC BY-SA 3.0. Having stood the test of time, Bodrum Castle is one of the city‚Äôs most historic landmarks that has survived a lot of battles during its lifetime. Known to the locals as the Castle of St Peter the Liberator of the Order of the Knights of the Hospital of St. John of Rhodes, the castle has been proudly standing for over six centuries.
sources.shortName: Top 24 Things To Do In Bodrum, Turkey - Updated 2024

sources.snippet: It‚Äôs probably the most photographed piece of architecture in Bodrum (and for all the right reasons). The history of this monument goes all the way back to when the town was named Halicarnassus, circa 4th Century B.C., and was partly built with stones from the Mausoleum ‚Äì one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
sources.shortName: 9 INSTA-WORTHY LOCATIONS IN BODRUM, TURKEY

sources.snippet: Peak season in Turkey stretches from around May to September, similar to other European destinations. I visited in the high season in Bodrum and didn‚Äôt find it to be too busy or hectic. The daytime temperature was hot, around 33 Celsius or so and it was blue skies and sunny.
sources.shortName: Bodrum Travel Guide- The Best Things to Do in Bodrum,Turkey

sources.snippet: Bodrum Castle is an impressive medieval castle built by the Knights of the Rhodes guards the entrance to Bodrum‚Äôs dazzling blue bay, in which the Aegean and Mediterranean Seas meet. It is one of the most visited sights in Bodrum.
sources.shortName: Bodrum City Center Guide: Holidays, Top Things to Do & See

sources.snippet: When in Bodrum you should certainly wander around its photogenic streets and classy boulevard past the many impressive yachts, restaurants and shops, leading you to a true hotspot at the end!
sources.shortName: Bodrum ‚Äì Turkey guide ‚Äì Top 6 activities & photo spots

sources.snippet: Don‚Äôt be fooled into thinking Bodrum is nothing but beaches and clubs. In fact, there are plenty of things to do in Bodrum that are bursting historical intrigue.
sources.shortName: COMPLETE GUIDE TO BODRUM BY THE LOCALS

places.name: Bodrum Castle

reviews.text: As with many castles this one was also rixh with history. We chose to explore on our own and found it to be a fantastic experience ( we really enjoy castles already and have seen many) but this one was fairly well preserved with many labels. It also includes a museum of a couple shipwrecks that have been partially re constructed which were truly fascinating.  ( Ill say no to buying tickets in advance because it was simple to do with a Visa or Mastercard at the entrance otherwise you must use Turkish Lira currency)

This place is huge and beautiful kept. We spent nearly 3 hours combing through every detail and exhibit. The grounds, museum and setting inside the castle takes you back to life in the country so many years ago. Definitely visit if you are in the Bodrum area. Very less crowds also, so you can really spend some time by yourself. Also, the photos of the harbour from the castle walls will come out so good!

Lovely museum, definitely worth visiting even during summertime thanks to the a/c installed in every exhibition room. The views of the city are incredible and if you get a guide you will be able to learn more about the history of the city.

places.generalDescription: The Mausoleum at Halicarnassus is an ancient archaeological site located in Bodrum, Turkey. The ruins date back to around 350 B.C. and are part of the ancient Greek city of Halicarnassus. The area has a distinctively Greek atmosphere with whitewashed houses adorned with bright blue accents. Despite being busy during peak tourist season, the port, marina, and waterfront promenade offer a relatively tranquil setting with various dining options.

sources.snippet: The Mausoleum at Halicarnassus, a testament to the ambition and extravagance of a Greek king who ruled Caria, was not merely a tomb, but a monument designed to inspire awe. This magnificent structure, built for a ruler known for his lavish lifestyle, was an architectural marvel adorned with intricate patterns, meticulously carved ornaments, and imposing statues. Beneath its impressive fa√ßade, the mausoleum's base housed a network of alleys leading to hidden rooms, said to have been overflowing with treasures and gold artifacts, reflecting the opulence of its royal occupant.
sources.shortName: Tourism in Bodrum: Escape To This Turkish Paradise

sources.snippet: In the eastern part of the modern city you‚Äôll find the ruins of Halicarnassus, built in the 4th century BC and considered one of the seven wonders of the ancient world. Its most famous landmark was the mausoleum of Halicarnassus; when it was destroyed by earthquakes in the 11th century, some of its stones were incorporated into the walls of Bodrum castle. The city was surrounded by walls for protection against the invaders and could be entered through two monumental gates; one of which, the Myndos gate, is still partly intact.
sources.shortName: 23 of the best things to do in Bodrum

sources.snippet: The Mausoleum of Halicarnassus, which is on the World Seven Wonders list, was built by his sister and his wife for King Mausolos. It was destroyed by earthquakes year by year. It is a large monument which carries traces of Greek and Egyptian architecture and has very magnificent architecture and that is really worth seeing this attraction.
sources.shortName: The Best Places to Visit in Bodrum ‚Äì Toursce Turkey

sources.snippet: The Mausoleum at Halicarnassus is one of the seven wonders of the world. At the past, Halicarnassus became famous because of its cruel Carian ruler Mausolus, who ordered the construction of a grandiose tomb for himself while he was alive. The huge tomb was supposed to overshadow all the buildings of the city.
sources.shortName: Discover Bodrum: Top 20 Things to Do

sources.snippet: The Mausoleum at Halicarnassus is a large tomb that was specially built for Mausolus. He was the ruler of Caria around 350 BC. It is regarded as one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World because of its marvelous marble structure that is intricately decorated with sculptures.
sources.shortName: Top 24 Things To Do In Bodrum, Turkey - Updated 2024

places.name: Mausoleum at Halicarnassus

reviews.text:
1 of the 7 wonders of the ancient world. It's definitely worth a visit and costs around 3 euros each for entry (April 2025)
You are able to walk through the site at your own pace.
The site is a 15-minute walk from the main bus  station, but there are also buses and taxis available.
Bring your own refreshments.
Toilets were available when we visited.

It is interesting only if you are a big lover of history, otherwise you may be disappointed. Entrance is 3 eur , and the mausoleum is not existing, it is only ruins. For me it was interesting, I love history very much!

The Mausoleum of Halicarnassus, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World, is a fascinating site rich in history and mystery. Though only ruins remain today, the scale and artistry of the original structure are still evident. Informative signs and preserved sculptures give insight into its grandeur and the legacy of King Mausolus. It's a must visit for history lovers in Bodrum, powerful, atmospheric, and a striking reminder of ancient architectural genius.

places.generalDescription: Milta Bodrum Marina is a prestigious marina located in the heart of Turkey's vibrant city, offering 450 berths and accessible from the city center. It features upscale restaurants, a shopping center with world-class brands, and lively bars. The marina overlooks Yalikavak Bay and offers services such as yacht repairs, charters, luxurious accommodation, and evening entertainment.

sources.snippet:
Source:
 Photo 
by Wikimedia Commons user
 Michal Osmenda 
used under CC BY-SA 2.0. Known as one of the most prestigious marinas in the Mediterranean and Aegean coastal waters, the Milta Bodrum Marina features great infrastructure, an accessible location from the city center, and a squad of experienced staff that will guide you through your journey across the sea. There is a total of 450 berths, security and health care that is available 24/7, a shopping center full of world-class brands, sophisticated restaurants, and lively bars that everyone will surely enjoy.
sources.shortName: Top 24 Things To Do In Bodrum, Turkey - Updated 2024

sources.snippet: Bodrum‚Äôs old town is a maze of souvenir shops and fish restaurants, and makes for the perfect respite from the glaring sun, with narrow alleyways providing shade. Avoid the usual overpriced knick-knacks and look for leather sandals, soaps, and the cotton towels that Turks use in the hammam (known here as pestemal) ‚Äî they will be locally made, high quality and extremely low in price.
sources.shortName: 23 of the best things to do in Bodrum

places.name: Milta Bodrum Marina

reviews.text:
Recently opened Divan Pub  Bodrum.
Location: excellent
Environment ; excellent
Service: excellent
Menu: very good
Price: reasonable
Divan Pub is probably the best diners chain in Turkey. Their quality is consistent at each of their locations. Divan Bodrum is located inside Bodrum Marina, with a beautiful view of the harbor from the upper level terrace. You can't go wrong with Divan Pub Bodrum.
Very nice and vibrant place. Plenty of restaurants and local markets . Lots of play areas for kids

Great Marina
Very attentive
My wife passed her
IYT crew
üôå

places.address: Eski√ße≈üme, Neyzen Tevfik Cd., 48400 Bodrum/Muƒüla, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Myndos Gate, located in Bodrum, is a significant historical site as it is the only remaining gate from the two gates that once protected the ancient city of Halikaranasos. The gate was part of a 7-km wall built for defense against external invasions. Visitors can explore the area and observe remnants of a trench where historians believe soldiers of Alexander the Great perished in 334 BC.

sources.snippet: The Myndos Gate, a must-see in west Bodrum, is the sole surviving gate from the ancient city of Halicarnassus‚Äôs protective walls. This landmark stands as a testament to the city's defensive architecture and strategic importance. Just beyond the gate, the remains of a trench serve as a reminder of the past, specifically the battles of 334 BC where soldiers of Alexander the Great met their end.
sources.shortName: Tourism in Bodrum: Escape To This Turkish Paradise

sources.snippet: It is one of the entrance gates of Halicarnassus and is estimated that it was built in 360 BC. Myndos Gate reveals the history of Bodrum. You can visit the area around Myndos Gate where the Turkish graveyards and vaulted graves belong to the Hellenistic and Roman periods.
sources.shortName: The Best Places to Visit in Bodrum ‚Äì Toursce Turkey

sources.snippet: It was the entrance gate to the ancient city of Halicarnassus on the west. The Myndos Gate is the only surviving monumental gate of the 7 km. long ancient city wall of Halikarnassos.
sources.shortName: Bodrum City Center Guide: Holidays, Top Things to Do & See
Attractions & Things to Do in Bodrum

places.name: Myndos Gate

reviews.text:
A great spot for a quick stop along the way: a pair of massive towers built from huge blocks with a passage between them gives a rare sense of the scale of the ancient walls of Halicarnassus. This is part of the 4th-century BCE fortifications built under King Mausolus; it was here, in 334 BCE, that fighting took place with Alexander the Great's forces-chronicles note that many defenders drowned in the ditches by the gate. Today the fragments of the towers with ‚Äústepped‚Äù corners and the roadway remain; the site is tidy, the path is easy, and there are brief info panels. Plan for 15‚Äì30 minutes: stroll, study the masonry, and take a panoramic photo. Best to come toward evening-soft light makes the stone read beautifully. Practical notes: wear shoes with good tread (the rock is slick); parking nearby is limited but manageable. Combined with the Mausoleum and St. Peter's Castle, it makes a well-rounded walk through the city's ancient history.
Aleks recommends üëç‚ùóÔ∏è

We bumped into this place completely by accident. At first it doesn't look like a monument at all because of the trash on the floor and the state of the ruins BUT once you pass by it, it looks pretty cool. At sunset it seems like the place to be if you climb to the top!

The gate is on the outskirts of Gumbet and is free to enter and look around. Not a great amount to see, but it does give a sense of ancient history. Best to Google the gate beforehand to give an idea of the siege that happened before this gate. Next to the hut, road side at the entrance is a Carob tree. The seeds were used hundreds of years ago to weigh other items as the seeds were all an identical weight and size. Also worth Googling!

places.generalDescription: The Bodrum Museum of Underwater Archaeology, located in Bodrum Castle, is a popular tourist attraction. It houses a diverse collection of artifacts from ancient shipwrecks and an extensive display of glass items. The museum provides detailed explanations about the time periods and circumstances surrounding the sinking of these ships, as well as the recovery process for these sunken relics. With Turkey's rich ancient history and numerous coastal battles, the museum continually unveils new exhibits related to underwater exploration.

sources.snippet: As we have mentioned above the Museum of Underwater Archeology is located inside St. Peter‚Äôs Castle and without any exaggeration, is one of the most visited Bodrum attractions. As you have probably already understood, you do not need to rent scuba gear in order to visit the Museum of Underwater Archeology in Bodrum. Instead of diving into the depths of the sea, you will have to climb to the top of a small mountain, where the Fortress of Bodrum is located.
sources.shortName: Discover Bodrum: Top 20 Things to Do

sources.snippet: Bodrum Museum of Underwater Archeology locates in Bodrum Castle, and it is one of the most important underwater archaeological museums of the world. You can add the museum, which has important works worth seeing, to the first place in the ‚ÄúPlaces to Visit in Bodrum‚Äù list. If you want to see underwater treasures, you can visit the Bodrum Museum of Underwater Archeology, which is open every year.
sources.shortName: The Best Places to Visit in Bodrum ‚Äì Toursce Turkey

sources.snippet: Bodrum Museum of Underwater Archaeology is situated inside the Bodrum Castle. It is one of the most rare underwater archaeology museums in the world. The Museum of Underwater Archaeology offers a collection of fascinating relics from the lives of ancient shipwrecked mariners, with glassware, copper-ware and gold items from the ship on display.
sources.shortName: Bodrum City Center Guide: Holidays, Top Things to Do & See

sources.snippet:
Source:
 Photo 
by Wikimedia Commons user
 JoJan 
used under CC BY-SA 3.0. Awarded as the European Museum of the Year in 1995, the Bodrum Museum of Underwater Archaeology was established in 1964 and can be found within the Bodrum Castle. This museum showcases a wide collection of artifacts from the past, which were found underwater.
sources.shortName: Top 24 Things To Do In Bodrum, Turkey - Updated 2024

sources.snippet: The Museum of Underwater Archaeology is inside Bodrum Castle. It showcases ancient treasures from different periods. You can see shipwrecks from Ancient Greece and artifacts from the Ottoman and Crusader eras.
sources.shortName: Top Best Places You Must Visit in Bodrum Turkey

sources.snippet: The vast amount of visitors that arrive are here for a lazy holiday of sun, sea, and sand, but when you feel the need for a change of scenery, the most popular way to sightsee is by boat.
sources.shortName: Attractions & Things to Do in Bodrum
COMPLETE GUIDE TO BODRUM BY THE LOCALS

places.name: Bodrum Museum Of Underwater Archaeology

reviews.text: Amazing views, it takes about 2 hours to walkthrough entire castle and museums. Unfortunately very expensive prices to enter museums and historical sites for tourists. Great views though.

Worth a visit if you're into archeology. Entry fee is on the pricey side. Some of the exhibits inside the towers aren't marked clearly until I saw someone coming out the door. Once inside there are some interesting exhibits but it was a nice way to cool off.

Lots of viewpoints for some nice photos. There's a cafe and museum shop onsite.

No air conditioning working in the exhibit areas.
Very expensive entry fee but not much to see.

places.generalDescription: Windmills Bodrum, a collection of 18th-century stone windmills, offers an enchanting and historical charm to the panoramic landscape of Bodrum. These architectural relics overlook the beautiful Bodrum and Gumbet Bays, strategically positioned to harness coastal winds. Despite their dilapidated state, the windmills provide a picturesque setting between Bodrum and Gumbet, offering breathtaking panoramic views from the mountains.

sources.snippet: *  A refreshing trip to the windmills of Bodrum will allow you to stretch your legs and find one of the magnificent Instagrammable places on the Turkish Peninsula. This location is far from other Bodrum's attractions and surroundings, and the mills stand in blissful silence above the harbour. Runaway from the city noise and linger among the ghosts of long-gone time.
sources.shortName: 12 Instagrammable places in Bodrum

sources.snippet: The white windmills on the hilltops, built in the 18th century and still in use as late as the 1970s, are an unmistakable Bodrum landmark. The best known are the seven that line the ridge of the peak between Bodrum and Gumbet, and they are the perfect backdrop for pictures snapped at sunset or sunrise.
sources.shortName: 23 of the best things to do in Bodrum

sources.snippet: Bitez Bay, about a 15-minute drive southwest of the main town center, has a more hushed activity level than Bodrum, so it‚Äôs a great place to recharge. The sand is white, the water is shallow and there are fewer people than what you‚Äôd usually find around the Bodrum marina. That means better photos!
sources.shortName: Top 12 Photography Spots in Bodrum: Bodrum Unveiled

sources.snippet: Situated on a hill between central Bodrum and Gumbet, the Windmills of Bodrum is a great place where you can come and see these magnificent structures, enjoy the stunning views of the bays and take unforgettable photos. Dating back to the 1970s, the windmills were used to grind flour.
sources.shortName: Bodrum City Center Guide: Holidays, Top Things to Do & See

sources.snippet: There‚Äôs a reason so many people come here every single day to watch the sun go down. The views offered on both sides of the hill are mesmerising, and seeing these ancient structures from up close, will go down as one of the most memorable experiences during your trip.
sources.shortName: 9 INSTA-WORTHY LOCATIONS IN BODRUM, TURKEY

sources.snippet: From the hilltop where this famous landmark is located, you can overlook the whole of the peninsula. There are 7 ancient mills here, just above Bodrum Bay, with Gumbet Bay on the other side and views even extending towards the Greek island Kos in the distance.
sources.shortName: Bodrum ‚Äì Turkey guide ‚Äì Top 6 activities & photo spots

sources.snippet: One of the best views of Bodrum can be viewed from windmills. It doesn‚Äôt matter at which time of the day you enjoy the view; it is always breathtaking. Visiting windmills is one of the unusual things to do in Bodrum, and definitely, a must do Bodrum.
sources.shortName: Discover Bodrum: Top 20 Things to Do

sources.snippet: A hike up to the Bodrum Windmills offers a quiet break and beautiful views of the harbor. These old windmills provide a nostalgic atmosphere away from the city noise. Take in the calm and enjoy the scenic views.
sources.shortName: Top Best Places You Must Visit in Bodrum Turkey

places.name: Windmills Bodrum

reviews.text:
The windmills of Bodrum are iconic structures located on the hills surrounding the town, particularly on the Gumbet Bay side. These windmills date back to the 18th century, when they were primarily used for grinding grain, especially wheat and barley. The region's strong and consistent winds made it an ideal location for windmills to harness wind energy for milling.
These are made of local stones. Over time, most of these windmills stopped functioning as mechanized milling methods took over. These are often photographed by tourists, especially at sunset.
there is not much to see here, the mill buildings are partially destroyed, there is a panoramic view of the bay, there are souvenir kiosks and swings, be prepared for strong wind and dust
Cool spot to catch the sunset - a hill with amazing views and these beautiful old windmill ruins that make it feel magical

places.address: Eski√ße≈üme Mh, Haremtan Sk. No:10, 48400 Bodrum/Muƒüla, T√ºrkiye

sources.snippet: * Come to Bodrum beach to enjoy Turkish life's lively atmosphere and capture the hustle and bustle of city residents on the beach. The sun loungers along the coast are perfect for posing, and all the services of the local bars are available for tourists. Of course, there will be more visitors on this beach than on other sandy places, as there are more locals than tourists, but if you need to take some amateur Instagram photos*, this location is ideal.
sources.shortName: 12 Instagrammable places in Bodrum

sources.snippet: Bitez Bay, about a 15-minute drive southwest of the main town center, has a more hushed activity level than Bodrum, so it‚Äôs a great place to recharge. The sand is white, the water is shallow and there are fewer people than what you‚Äôd usually find around the Bodrum marina. That means better photos!
sources.shortName: Top 12 Photography Spots in Bodrum: Bodrum Unveiled

reviews.text: Very picturesque beach, small but not noisy or overcrowded, at least in September. No sand but very small rocks, which is perfectly ok to walk barefoot. The water temperature is ideal, warm and calm. There are also free straw umbrellas to use.

The city beach is considered to be free but there aren't good umbrellas or sunbeds. So, you have to pay 150-200 liras to cafes which provide those. The other option is to find cafes where you promise to buy drinks and food during your stay.

Unfortunately, the beach is stony but manageable. You forget about all extra money you pay, inconvenient ground under your feet when you see and swim in beautiful waters of the sea üåä
However, at 10am the sea throws out trash from tourists going on boat trips (cans, cigarettes, etc).

Bodrum Beach has a nice vibe and beautiful scenery, but it's not the best spot for swimming or relaxing by the sea. The beach is very rocky, and there are lots of sea urchins and sharp stones in the water, so getting in can be tricky without water shoes. There are also many boats and yachts anchored close to the shore, which takes away from the natural feel and limits swimming space. The beach is quite dirty with lots of cigarette buts. Overall, it's an okay place to enjoy the view or grab a drink nearby, but not ideal for a beach day.
